hedline.hl1: More Job Training Will Shrink Welfare

abstract.p: Philip Coltoff letter comments on April 14 article on shortcomings in New York City's workfare program (S)

block.p: ''As Idaho Booms, Prisons Fill and Spending on Poor Lags'' (front page, April 16) notes that in Idaho, ''writing a bad check . . . can land a person in prison.'' While serving time for a bounced check may seem harsh, I find it refreshing that there are places in this country where the line between right and wrong is well defined and the repercussions for crossing that line are certain. Welfare policies aside, Idaho's approach to creating high standards for what constitutes criminal behavior is a model worth following.
STEVEN R. BECKER New York, April 17, 1998
